P115938.project_name: Rapid Response Child-Focused Social Cash Transfer and Nutrition Security Project

keywords.cdata: beneficiaries, CASH TRANSFER, cash transfer program, cash transfer scheme, cash transfers, community nutrition, disbursement, economic shocks, equipment, Expenditure, finances, financial management, food insecurity, food prices, households, human development, indebtedness, legal covenants, living conditions, Local Governments, malnutrition, NUTRITION, payment service, remittances, Trust Fund, urban areas

project_abstract.cdata: The development objective of the Child-Focused Social Cash Transfer and Nutrition Security Project for Senegal is to reduce the risk of nutrition insecurity of vulnerable populations, in particular children under five in poor rural and urban areas, by scaling up the Government Nutrition Enhancement Program and providing cash transfers to vulnerable mothers of children under five. The reallocation of the credit proceeds is needed to enhance project effectiveness by ensuring the funding for the program's central component on sub-grants for community nutrition sub-projects. The reallocation aims to strengthen the support to the cash transfer program and maintain the coverage and strengthen the intensity of the community-based activities, particularly in light of the negative impact of the external economic shocks on poverty and nutrition.  The reallocation is made possible because of economies made on the categories of drugs and pharmaceutical supplies, consulting services, training, audits and operating costs over the course of the project implementation, mainly as the result of new support from other donor sources and and/or increased Government contributions.  No changes are being made to the development objectives, outcomes, design, or scope of the project.
